newsitem.title: INDIA: RBI to extend cheap credit to all "deemed" exports.
newsitem.headline: RBI to extend cheap credit to all "deemed" exports.

text.p: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) will extend export credit facilities in rupees at a concessional rate of interest to all "deemed exports", the Finance Ministry said in a statement on Monday.
Indian authorities extend special benefits to "deemed exports" which represent a category of sales made domestically but in the face of competition from international suppliers.
The central bank had so far extended concessional credit under the category only to projects that were financed by specific bilateral or multilateral lending agencies, the statement said.
"The RBI has advised banks to extend pre-shipment credit and post-supply credit for a maximum period of 30 days or the actual date of payment by the receiver of goods, whichever is earlier," it said.
It said banks would be eligible to obtain refinance for such credit from the RBI.
